data.title: Where do they film ‘Outer Banks’? Seasons 1 and 2 Filming Locations - Netflix Tudum
data.meta_description: Travel like a Pogue, from South Carolina to the Bahamas.
data.text:
On Outer Banks, the Pogues are constantly on the run, escaping danger and hunting down treasure. With all that fast-paced action comes multiple locations — indeed, look away for a second while watching and the Pogues could be washing up on a completely different shore from where you last saw them.

Set in the Outer Banks of North Carolina, the first two seasons of the series follow the adventure-seeking friend group as they hop onto cargo ships, sneak into abandoned churches and break into opulent mansions. Season 3, which premieres Feb. 23, picks up with the Pogues living their best lives on a deserted island which they’ve deemed Poguelandia. Like we mentioned, this group gets around. Ahead of the new season, experience what it means to be a Pogue 4 life, by taking a tour of the Outer Banks filming locations — from the shores of South Carolina to the beaches of the Bahamas.

Season 1

Episode 1

Kildare Island

Commonly referred to as the “Outer Banks” in the show, this fictional barrier island off the coast of North Carolina is a beach town with feuds aplenty. Outer Banks is mainly set on Kildare Island, which is split into two territories: Figure 8 on the north side where the wealthy Kooks reside, and the Cut on the south side where the lower-income Pogues live.

Filming location: Although Kildare is an imagined place, the Outer Banks are real barrier islands in North Carolina home to coastal sites including Dare County and the town of Kill Devil Hills. However, the series films primarily around Charleston, South Carolina. The Pogues’ waterfront boat scenes are mainly filmed on Shem Creek in Mount Pleasant, a tourist town located eight miles east of Charleston.

Heyward’s Seafood

In the world of the show, you can’t make a trip to Kildare without paying a visit to Heyward’s Seafood. Owned by Pope (Jonathan Daviss)’s dad Heyward (E. Roger Mitchell), this joint is located right on the shore and is known for its fresh shrimp. When he’s not out hunting treasure with the Pogues, Pope helps his dad out around the restaurant.

Filming location: The real-life Geechie Seafood is a fresh seafood market located along Shem Creek in Mount Pleasant.

Tannyhill Plantation

Located in Figure 8, the Tannyhill Plantation is home to Sarah Cameron (Madelyn Cline) and her family. This mansion is an architectural dream with white Doric columns, a spacious green lawn and a spiral staircase which seems custom-made for dramatic family entrances. The property once belonged to Denmark Tanny, a formerly enslaved man who was the sole survivor of the Royal Merchant shipwreck in the 19th century, and the alleged source of the treasure at the core of the plot of Outer Banks.

Filming location: Lowndes Grove sits along the banks of the Ashley River in Charleston. The 14-acre estate was built in 1786 and is now a venue for weddings and events.

The Chateau

John B (Chase Stokes) lives at the Chateau and still maintains the residence even after the disappearance of his dad, Big John (Charles Halford). Charming in its own way, this property also serves as a meeting ground for his Pogue friends. There’s a backyard decked out in fairy lights, a boat dock for easy water transportation and even a chicken coop (used mostly to hide from bounty hunters).

Filming location: Scenes at the Chateau are filmed in the Secessionville Historic District in Charleston.

The Boneyard

The Cut meets Figure 8 at the Boneyard. John B describes this popular beach hangout spot as a “three-layer burrito,” where the scrappy Pogues, preppy Kooks and clueless Tourons, aka tourists, come together to party. However, drinking beer with your sworn enemies isn’t always a fun time. The Boneyard is where John B and Topper (Austin North) get into a drunken brawl in Episode 1.

Filming location: Hunting Island, a state park located 15 miles east of Beaufort, South Carolina, is the perfect stand-in for the Boneyard due to its sandy beaches and sprawling driftwood. It is, however, primarily known for its historic lighthouse (see below) and nature trails.

Episode 2

Redfield Lighthouse

After finding his dad’s compass in the Royal Merchant wreckage, John B and Kiara (Madison Bailey) go to the Redfield Lighthouse hoping to get more answers about Big John and the shipwreck’s whereabouts. Unfortunately, the visit doesn’t go as planned when the lighthouse keeper grows suspicious of the teens and calls the cops on them.

Filming location: The Hunting Island Lighthouse is located in Hunting Island, South Carolina. Although it’s no longer functioning, this historic landmark is the only publicly accessible lighthouse in South Carolina.

The Wreck

Just like Pope’s family, Kiara’s is also in the restaurant business. Owned by her parents, the Wreck serves as a popular hangout spot for the Pogues. Kiara is often busy waiting tables and serving customers — but, much to her parents’ dismay, she isn’t afraid to ditch work to help her friends when they’re in trouble.

Filming location: The Wreck of the Richard and Charlene is the real restaurant where scenes featuring Kiara’s family’s business were filmed. This laid-back seafood dive is located on the banks of Shem Creek in Mount Pleasant. The restaurant is named after a boat wrecked there during Hurricane Hugo in 1989.

Episode 3

Surfrider cleanup

As much as the Kooks love a good beach party, they also understand the importance of preserving their natural habitat. In Episode 3, Sarah, Topper and their Kook friends spend the day cleaning up the Masonboro beach.

Filming location: Hunting Island State Park is a popular destination for surfing, bonfires and camping. The beach cleanup is based on an annual post-Fourth of July event that takes place on Masonboro Island in North Carolina.

Episode 4

Ben Silver

John B and Sarah grow even closer when they take a secret day trip to the UNC Law Library in Chapel Hill to gather clues about Denmark Tanny. Before hitting the books, they stop into Ben Silver so that Sarah can give John B a much-needed makeover.

Filming location: Ben Silver on King Street in downtown Charleston is go-to spot for Kook clothing. This historic district is a popular shopping and dining hub.

University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill Law Library

After moving into the Tannyhill Plantation, Ward Cameron (Charles Esten) donated Denmark Tanny’s diary, almanac and other records to the UNC Law Library in Chapel Hill. In an effort to gather more clues, John B and Sarah dig through the archives there.

Filming location: These scenes were filmed at the Charleston Gaillard Center, a nonprofit arts center in downtown Charleston that hosts music, dance, comedy and theater performances.

Ferry dock

Their day trip might be over, but the chemistry is just beginning for John B and Sarah. Upon their return from UNC Chapel Hill, the pair share their first kiss at the ferry dock in the rain.

Filming location: On their trip home, John B and Sarah take the Carolina Belle, a boat operated by Charleston Harbor Tours. As for their first kiss, the romantic scene was filmed on the Charleston Maritime Center pier.

Episode 5

Kildare County High School

Yes, the Pogues actually go to school… well, sometimes. John B stops by Mr. Sunn (Chris Gerard)’s classroom to get some help translating Denmark Tanny’s letter, which is written in Gullah, a creole language.

Filming location: Outer Banks’ high school scenes are filmed at a local middle school in Charleston.

Island Club

The Kooks’ Midsummers soirée is hosted at Island Club, a bougie country club in Figure 8. For one night, Kildare’s Kooks put on their finest gowns and pastel-colored suits for an evening of drinks and dancing. Meanwhile, the Pogues must work their shift, serving their rivals.

Filming location: Kiawah Island Golf Resort serves as the setting for this lavish Kook affair. The premier luxury beach resort offers guests championship golf and five-star amenities.

Hawk’s Nest tower

After seeing John B and Sarah kiss at Island Club, Topper catches the pair sneaking off to the top of the Hawk’s Nest tower. In a jealous rage, he pushes John B over the ledge — literally.

Filming location: The Palmetto Park Islands Observation Tower in Mount Pleasant is a prime spot if you’re looking for a good view of the marshland and trees in Palmetto Islands County Park.

Episode 6

Crain House

Using the Tannyhill Plantation map, the Pogues sneak into a creepy old house owned by the mysterious Crain family, where they believe the gold is hidden. The friends make their way into the basement and discover a well that might hold the treasure.

Filming location: The home used as the Crain residence is located in the Cannonborough Elliotborough neighborhood in Charleston.

Episode 7

John B’s bell tower

There’s no place more romantic than an abandoned church. John B takes Sarah to his secret spot and shows her the bell tower he likes to go to. Big John used to frequent this old relic when he was younger, and now John B is keeping his father’s tradition alive. In Episode 9, Rafe (Drew Starkey) burns down the church while John B and Sarah are hiding there after Sheriff Peterkin’s (Adina Porter) murder.

Filming location: The Old Bethel AME Church is an abandoned Civil War–era church located in McClellanville, South Carolina.

Season 2

Episode 1

Island Inn

While working his summer job serving Kooks at the Island Inn, JJ (Rudy Pankow) overhears Topper and his friends speculating about how John B killed Sheriff Peterkin. Fed up with the rumors, he gets into a scuffle with them and ends up fired from his job.

Filming location: The Seabrook Island Beach Club is a vacation destination in Seabrook Island, South Carolina.

Nassau, the Bahamas

Although presumed dead, John B and Sarah have actually been rescued by captain Terrance (Terence Rosemore) and his crew on their way to Nassau, the Bahamas. However, when Terrance discovers that John B and Sarah are wanted, the teens have to escape into the streets of Nassau.

Filming location: Outer Banks actually filmed in Barbados, not the Bahamas. The street scenes took place in the Careenage area of Bridgetown, the capital of Barbados.

Fairmont Hotel

John B and Sarah seek refuge in this five-star hotel after fleeing captain Terrance and his crew members. The Fairmont Hotel was a regular vacation spot for the Camerons back in the day.

Filming location: The Fairmont Royal Pavilion is a luxury oceanfront resort in Barbados.

Paradise Island

As if the Camerons’ residence at Tannyhill wasn’t already extravagant enough, their vacation home in the Bahamas shows you just how well off they are. John B and Sarah break into the mansion with Terrance and Cleo (Carlacia Grant) to find the hidden $400 million in gold that Ward stole.

Filming location: The Royal Westmoreland, Barbados, is a golf and beach resort in Saint James, Barbados.

Episode 3

Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge

As John B and Sarah travel back to the Outer Banks after a dangerous trip to Nassau, they pass by the Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge just as their Pogue friends JJ, Kiara and Pope, drive over the viaduct.

Filming Location: The Arthur Ravenel Jr. Bridge is a 1,546-foot long viaduct that connects Charleston to Mount Pleasant.

Episode 4

27 King Street

Pope, JJ and Kiara travel to Charleston to meet with a mysterious woman named Carla Limbrey (Elizabeth Mitchell). When they arrive at 27 King Street, only Pope is allowed inside the home. During their meeting, Carla reveals that she has a recording that proves Rafe killed Sheriff Peterkin. In exchange, she wants Pope to hand over the Denmark Key. There’s just one problem — Pope has no idea what that is or where to find it.

Filming location: Carla’s home was filmed at the Edmondston-Alston House in the Battery, a historic promenade in Charleston. The mansion was completed in 1828 and is now a house museum.

Episode 5

Kildare County Courthouse

Chaos breaks out at the courthouse between the Kooks and Pogues when John B is charged with first-degree murder and faces the death penalty for Sheriff Peterkin’s killing.

Filming location: The Eternal Father of the Sea Chapel in North Charleston is a wedding venue, built during World War II.

Kildare County Detention Center

Life behind bars is even more dangerous than treasure hunting for John B. As he awaits his fate, JJ pays a visit and devises an elaborate plan to get his best friend out of jail. Before they can put this escape into action, an inmate is paid to strangle John B to death, but ultimately fails.

Filming location: The detention center was filmed at the International Diving Institute in North Charleston.

Guerin’s Pharmacy

Pope’s father reveals that his grandmother used to wear the Denmark Key around her neck. The mission to find the key brings Pope to his grandma’s old apartment, located above Guerin’s Pharmacy. After a thorough search, he finds the key hidden in her ceiling.

Filming location: Guerin’s Pharmacy is located on Main Street in Summerville, South Carolina.

Episode 8

Freedman’s Assembly of God

The Pogues are up against Carla and Rafe to find the seven-foot Cross of Santo Domingo. They make their way to an old abandoned church after reading this clue in a spyglass: “You’ve come this far, do not falter. The cross is on the Freedman’s altar.” To their disappointment, the cross is nowhere to be seen. However, upon further inspection, Pope discovers that it’s actually built into the structure of the church.

Filming location: Freedman’s exterior was filmed at the St. Thomas & St. Denis Parish in Charleston. The church was the scene of the 1876 Cainhoy Massacre, a deadly race riot between Black and white South Carolinians in the months leading up to the gubernatorial election of that year.

Episode 10

Poguelandia

It’s a wild ride for the Pogues. The teens hide in the Camerons’ cargo ship that’s en route to Guadalupe and plan a takeover to rescue Sarah. However, they ultimately lose the Cross of Santo Domingo to the Camerons and jump off the ship into a lifeboat. There’s truly nothing left to lose as they wash ashore onto a deserted island, which JJ calls Poguelandia.

Filming location: Bathsheba Beach in Barbados is known for its dramatic rock formations along the shoreline.

Season 3

Episode 1

Plane crash

The Pogues have survived just about every type of accident at this point, so why not throw a plane crash into the fold? After being rescued from Poguelandia by a private plane, the rescue mission goes south (literally) when the teens, suspecting the pilot works with Ward, ambush him and crash the aircraft into the ocean. As the rest of the Pogues swim to shore, Kiara goes back to save the injured pilot but ends up getting captured.

Filming location: The cast filmed the crash in the waters of Port St. Charles, a Caribbean marina and resort near Speightstown, Barbados.

Barbados

Paradise in Poguelandia is short-lived, and the teens soon find themselves on a rescue mission in Barbados. Carlos Singh (Andy McQueen) holds Kiara captive at his compound and the Pogues must find a way to get their friend back. During their time on the island, they’re seen running around its city streets.

Filming location: Bridgetown, the capital city, serves as the backdrop for most of the Pogues’ Barbados adventures.

The Camerons’ Guadalupe estate

By Season 3, the Camerons have fled to their mansion in Guadalupe with the Cross of Santo Domingo. There, Ward tasks Rafe with the job of selling the treasure for a fortune.

Filming location: The exterior of this luxury property is one of many vacation homes along Cattlewash Beach on the eastern coast of Barbados.

Carlos Singh’s estate

Singh’s estate is no vacation home for Kiara and Rafe who are locked inside with tight security roaming the premises. While there, they learn that Singh is after Denmark Tanny’s original diary, which he believes holds clues that will lead him to El Dorado.

Filming location: The Lion Castle Estate in St. Thomas, Barbados, is a historic site that includes a plantation house, apartment buildings and cottages.

Episode 2

Big John’s bell tower

Back in OBX, before he was lost at sea, Big John would call his son John B home by ringing a bell tower. As the Pogues are running around Barbados, Big John rings the bell of an old church in the hope that his son will hear and come searching for him. At the end of Episode 2, John B leaves his friends at the dock and follows the sounds of the bell, which leads him to an old church on a hill.

Filming location: St. John Parish Church is an Anglican church located near Hackleton’s cliff in St. John, Barbados. The current building, constructed in 1836, replaced previous structures destroyed in storms including the original, built around 1645, believed to be one of the oldest churches on the island.

Episode 3

Charleston Museum

One of the stops on Big John and John B’s hunt for artifacts is the Charleston Museum. Posing as a paleogenetics professor from the University of South Carolina, Big John tries to convince the museum staff to let him view pieces excavated from the Trinity Church, but fails. Later that night, they sneak back in and pull off a heist to steal the missing piece of the Gnomon of Solana, a stone object that they believe will help lead them to El Dorado.

Filming location: The Charleston Museum is the oldest museum in the United States, located in downtown Charleston.

Episode 9

Kitty Hawk Adventure Therapy

Before the Pogues fly to South America to save Big John, they all go home to say their farewells. Kiara has prepared a speech for her parents, but they ambush her, and two representatives from Kitty Hawk Adventure Therapy drag her away to their behavioral camp.

Filming location: St. Christopher Camp and Conference Center is located in Seabrook Island, South Carolina.

Episode 10

El Dorado cave

Big John, John B and Sarah race through the South American jungle, trying to reach El Dorado before Singh does. They finally arrive at a cave that looks promising, but Big John is too injured to proceed after being shot by Singh. It’s up to John B and Sarah to find El Dorado alone.

Filming location: Although on the show El Dorado ends up being located in South America, the cast and crew filmed the jungle scenes in Barbados. The Welchman Hall Gully is a tropical park open to the public for hiking along its nature trails, cave tours and wild monkey sightings.

Outer Banks Season 1 and 2 RecapCatch up on everything that happened before season 3.
